comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Could be Ernst (Ernest) Ludwig, the Austrian consul at Cleveland. He was accused to have paid USD 400 for affidavits charging that the liner Lusitania carried guncotton when sunk. (The New York Times, December 3, 1915 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0F12FD3E5A15738...) According to The Washington times, September 11, 1915, HOME EDITION, Page 1 he was on a list of „In Bads“ of the State Departement, see article „U. S. TO CLEAN OUT FOREIGN CONSPIRATORS“. chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn84026749/1915-09-11/ed-... Obviously he was involved in the "Dumba Affair". Konstantin Dumba see
